p: Foraging techniques were categorized as ‘probe’ (rapidly inserting the beak into moss or dead leaves), ‘bite’ (chipping off parts of bark or removing moss with the beak), ‘glean’ (taking food directly from a substrate surface), ‘sally’ (aerial attack) and ‘feed’ (only used on plant food sources like ‘nectar’, ‘fruit’ and ‘seed’), following Tebbich et al. ( 2004).
